respStmt.resp: XML encoding, hyperlinking and textual cleanup

availability.p: This text may be freely distributed, subject to the following restrictions:

item.s: You credit Perseus, as follows, whenever you use the document:
item.quote: Text provided by Perseus Digital Library, with funding from The U.S. Department of Education and The Max Planck Society.

list.item: You leave this availability statement intact.
You offer Perseus any modifications you make.

notesStmt.note: Initial XML cleanup by Alpheios Technical Services, LLC.
Major XML restructuring and text-correction by Winfried H. Leclaire (quranic-research.net)
Additional proofreading by Naveed Ul Islam (lanelexicon.com)

list.item: First issue published by Perseus Digital Library on 07th April 2011

sense.s: ka prefixed to a noun is called kaAfu AltRaXobiyhi The k of comparison. Respecting its being prefixed to pronouns, see Oano, suprà, p. 106.
UijoEalo hecaA AlXRaIoCa kaOosFA waAHidFA Make thou this thing to be [uniform, or] of one way, or mode, or manner. (ISk, in TA, art. bOj.)
kacelika The like thereof; such like; and simply such; and so.
kaUK and kMCK: see kaOaIRK or kaOayRino voce OaIRN.
kamaA followed by a pret. often means Like as when: see an ex. in a verse cited above, p. 740.
kamaA is often followed by a pret. in the sense of an aor.: see exs. in EM., pp. 41 & 214.
kamaA Oanota waziyodFA [Keep as, or where, thou art, and approach not Zeyd! like makaAnaka wazayodFA]. Heard by Ks. (L, art. End.)
kamaAOanotaniI Wait for me where thou art! Heard by Az from certain of the Benoo-Suleym. (L, art. End.)

k of allocution is varied like the pronominal affix of the sec. pers., accord. to the sex and number of the persons addressed: see exs. in the Kur, iii. 42 and xix. 21 (Flügel's ed., and Lees' Keshsháf), xii. 37, ii. 46, &c., and xii. 32. But sometimes the same form is used in addressing a number of persons as in addressing one man: see, for ex., Kur, iv. 96.
1. kabana: see Sabana.
kabana AlvRawoba: see gabana.
kabaA: said of a horse: see above, art. Hanaca, p. 656 b.
See also a phrase voce salRapN.
kabaA He fell upon his face: (K, TA:) or so kabaA liwajohihi: S, TA:) and kabAa also signifies Eavara [he stumbled, or tripped]. (TA.)
R. Q. 1. katokata: see TaHoTaHa.
kutokutN The coarse part of silk, and of tow, &c.

kitaAbN (same as EaqodN) The ceremony (not certificate) of a marriage-contract. katabuwAkitaAbahu EalaI fulaAnapK They performed the ceremony of the contract of his marriage to such a woman (same as EqdwA Eaqodahu).
Oaholu AlkitaAbi: see OaholN.
katifN [The shoulder-blade;] a wide bone behind the shoulder-joint. (Mgh.)
[Hence, The shoulder itself.] See TurRapN and muWurRabN.
kuitofAanN, as an epithet applied to the locust, see in TA, voce musayRaHN. See also jaraAdN.
kitaAfN of a zabiyl: see HatiIRN.
katiyfapN i. q. DabRapN A broad piece of iron. A poet speaks of a wooden vessel of which a fracture is mended with a ktyfp. (S.)
2. katRalahu, inf. n. takotiylN, He made it (OaqiT [&c.]) into lumps, or compact pieces or portions. (TA.)
And He, or it, fattened him. (Kr, TA.)
5. takatRala It became compacted together in a mass; it became lumpy. See qiyda, art. qwd.

kutolapN A lump, or compact piece or portion, (S, M, * Msb, K,) of a thing, (Msb,) or of gum, &c., (S,) or of dates, and of clay, &c.: (M, K:) a piece, or portion, of dates packed together in a receptacle: (Mgh:) and a piece of flesh-meat. (K.)
ktlp i. q. zabiylN. (TA in art. HSn.)

mikotalN A zinobiyl, (Msb, K,) or thing like a zinobiyl, [or zabiyl,] (S,) holding fifteen measures of the quantity termed SaAE; (S, K;) it is a thing [or basket] made of palm-leaves, in which dates, &c., are carried. (Msb.)
mukatRalN Round and compact; (K;) applied to a head: (TA:) short (S, K, TA) and strong: (TA:) a man thick in body, (K, TA,) compact therein, and inclining to shortness. (TA.)

1. katama, aor.
katuma
, inf. n. katomN [and kitomaAnN], doubly trans., He concealed, or suppressed, a secret. (Mgh.)
katama AlrRabowa: see a verse cited in the last paragraph of art. Ewr.
5. takatRama (K, art. dls) He (a man) concealed, or hid, himself. (T, K, same art.)
6. takaAtamuwA They practised concealment, one with another: see tadaAfanuwA.
kaAtimN meaning makotuwmN: see daAfiqN, in two places.
fiI kaAtimi AlsRirRi: see a verse cited in conj. 3 of art. ErD.
katanN for katRaAnN: see an ex. in a verse cited voce XaAribN.
kujRapN, see bukosapN in the K and TA.
4. OakoHaTa: see OaqoHaTa, in two places.
1. kaHala (assumed tropical:) He put out, or blinded, an eye with a heated nail, &c.: see an ex. voce samara.
8. maA QkotaHalotu gamaADFA gimaADFA &c.: see OagomaDa. See also HavAavN.
10. AisotakoHala AlsRahara (assumed tropical:) [He became sleepless; as though he took sleeplessness as a collyrium]. (TA in art. Hls, from a trad.)
kaHolN and kaHolu (S, K) A year of drought, barrenness, or dearth; (S;) a hard year. (K.)
kuHayolN a proper name for A horse of high breed; as also kuHayolAanN↓. (TA.)
kuHayolN Tar (qaTiraAn) in the dial. of El-Hijáz. (TA, voce garobN; from the T.) See nfoZN.
kuHayolAanN: see kuHayolN.
EayonN kaHolaMCu An eye that is black, [or black in the edges of the lids,] by nature, as though it had kuHol applied to it. (Mgh.) Not in the TA. [It seems to have both of these meanings.]
kaHolaMCu A certain plant: see K, voce XinojaAr: calendula arvensis: see Delile, Flor. Aeg., no. 864.
AlOakoHalu The median vein. See wariydN and Oabojalu and Oaboharu and AlSRaAfinu.
1. kadama He bit with the fore part of the mouth. (S, Msb, K.)
6. takaAdumu AlHumuri [The wild asses' biting one another with the fore part of the mouth]. (TA in art. sHj.) See also tasaAnRat.
kacobaAnuwnapN [Pers. kadobaAnw] An intelligent housewife, who is a good manager. (K, art. hlj; but omitted in some copies.)
kuciynaqN: see midaqRN, in art. dqR.

entry.xml:id: flAn yukaArizu En AlHq AlI AlbATl

form.orth: flAn yukaArizu En AlHq AlI AlbATl

sense.s: 3. flAn yukaArizu En AlHq AlI AlbATl, inf. n. mukaArazapN: i. q. yuEaAjizu, expl. in art. Ejz. (TA, art. Ejz.)
7. Ainokarasa fiI AlXRaIoCi He entered into the thing and concealed himself. (IKtt, in TA, art. nms.)
kurosiIRu AlxaAtami (T, K, art. bZr) The bezel of the ring. (TK.)
kirosanRapN, thus written: (TA:) [Bitter vetch:] see xaAniqN.
kirosiniIRN [or karosaniIRN] A sort of HimRaS. (The Minháj, in TA, art. HmS.)
karXN or kiroXN The plant so named: see raqamapN.
kariySN A kind of OaqiT: see kavoCN.
mikoraSN: i. q. miDorab, q. v.
1. karaEa fiI AlmaMCi, and fiI AlUinaMCi, He put his mouth into the water, or into the vessel, and so drank. (See EabRa.)
karAaEN: see EidRN.
kuraAEN: see HarRapN, rakaDa, ciraAEN, and badanN.
kurosuwEN The prominent extremity of the ulna, next to the little finger, at the wrist. (S, * K.)
kurokiIRN The Numidian crane; ardea virgo: also called UiwazRN EirAaqiIRN, and wazRN EiraAqiIRN. See Oabuw AlEayozaAri and guronayoqN.
1. karuma, inf. n. karamN, It (a thing) was, or became, highly esteemed or prized or valued; excellent, precious, valuable, or rare: (Msb:) followed by Ealayohi: see 1 in art. fjE.

karumato OaroDuhu His land yielded increase of its seed-produce, (ISh, K,) and its soil became good, (ISh,) being manured; (ISh, K;) [or it was, or became, generous, or good; i. e., productive, or fertile].
karumotu Ealayohi, (S, K, art. Ez,) I exceeded him in generosity, or nobleness. (TK, voce EazRN.)
2. karRamahu EalaIRa [He honoured him above me]. (Kur, xvii. 64).
karRamahu Eano kacaA [He preserved him from such a thing]: see an ex. in a verse cited in art. El (conj. 3): and see, here, 4 and 5.
karRama He highly regarded a horse or the like.
See takorimapN.
4. Oakoramahu He treated him with honour, or courtesy.
Oakorama, and Aisotakorama↓, He found a generous horse (farasFA kariymFA). (TA in art. rbT.) See rabaTa.
Oakoramotu Eanohu EiroDiI I preserved myself from it. (S in art. ErD. See also 2.)
5. takarRama Eanohu, and takaArama↓, He shunned it; avoided it; kept, or removed, himself far from it; or preserved himself from it; (K;) for in stance, from foul speech. (TA in art. dqE.)
takarRama He affected, or constrained himself, to be generous. (S.)
6: see 5.
10. Aisotakorama AlXRaIoCa: see 10 in art. frh.
See also 4.
Uibonu Alkaromi The qiTof [i. e. grape, or bunch of grapes]. (T in art. bnI.)
karamN in a horse, &c., generous quality. See HasabN; and see kariymN, and makorumapN, and XariyfN.
cuw AljalaAli waAlUikoraAmi (Kur, lv. 27) Possessed of majesty, or greatness, and bounty: (Jel:) or, of absolute independence and universal bounty. (Bd.)
Alkurokumu AlSRagiyru: see AlEuruwqu AlSRuforu.
kariymN Generous; liberal; honourable: noble; high-born; contr. of laYiymN. (K, &c.)
[A generous, a noble, a high-bred, a well-born, or an excellent, horse, &c.; of generous, high, or good, breed or quality.]
A thing highly esteemed or prized or valued; excellent, precious, valuable, or rare. (Msb.)
[OaroDN kariymapN Productive land. See karumato OaroDuhu.]
baEiyrN kariymN EalaI Oaholihi [A camel held in high estimation by his owner]. (TA in art. dfE.)
[wajohu QllRehi Alkariymu means The glorious face of God: see an ex. voce suboHapN.]
karAaYimu AlmaAli (TA) or AlOamowaAli (Mgh, Msb) Such as are held in high estimation, precious, or excellent, of cattle or other possessions; (Mgh, Msb, TA;) the choice, or best, thereof. (Mgh, Msb.)
HubRFA wakaraAmapN, see HubRN.
laA walaA karaAmapF No; nor a jar-cover: i. e., No: (I will not give thee, or I will not do, what thou requirest,) nor anything else. See HubRN; and see takorimap.

karAamapN, the kind of miracle so called: pl. karaAmaAtN; like the term χαρίσματα as used by St. Paul in 1 Cor. xii. 9: it may be well rendered thaumaturgy: and SAaHibu karAamaAtK a thaumaturgus, or thaumaturgist: see muEojizahN, and qaraAsapN.
Oakoramu in the sense of kariymN, as in Oakoramuhumo OabFA: see bayaADN.
takorimapN, syn. with takoriymN; (Mgh;) subst. from karRamotuhu; as also karaAmapN↓. (Msb.)
makoramapN A means. or cause, of attaining honour. (Mgh, Msb.)
makorumN: see OaluwkN and yusorN.
makorumapN A generous, or honourable, quality or action. (Msb, &c.)
EaliIa fiI AlmakaArimi [He became eminent in generous, or honourable, actions or practices or qualities or dispositions]. (Msb in art. Elw.)
makaArimu may often be rendered Excellencies.

OaroDN makorumapN and karamN↓ (tropical:) Generous, good, land: (K, TA:) [good and fertile land:] or dunged and tilled land. (TA.) And OaroDN makorumapN lilnRabaAvi (tropical:) Land producing good herbage or plants. (S,
TA. [In some copies of the S, good for herbage or plants.])
1. karihahu [He disliked, was displeased with, disapproved of, hated, him or it.] AlkaraAhapu is the contr. of AlUiraAdapu and AlrRiDaI. (Marg. note in TA.)

karihahu (Mgh, Msb), inf. n. karaAhapN and karaAhiyapN, (Mgh,) or kurohN and karohN, (Msb,) He did not desire it; he disapproved it, or was displeased or discontented with it; (Mgh;) he disliked it; disapproved it; hated it; contr. of HabRahu. (Msb.)
kariha and takarRaha↓: see saxiTa.
2. karRahotu Uilayohi AlXRaIoCa, inf. n. takoriyhu, I made the thing to be an object of dislike, disapprobation, or hatred, to him. (S, K. *)
4. Oakorahotuhu EalaI kadaA I made him to do such a thing against his will. (S.)
5. takarRahahu He showed, or expressed, dislike, disapprobation, or hatred, of it; see taAajRamahu and tasaxRaTahu: and Ealyohi takaAraha↓ signifies the same; see qanaHa.

takarRaha He expressed dislike, displeasure, disapprobation, discontent, or hatred. (IbrD.) See examples in the K, voce OaxRo, and voce OafRo, &c. The above is the prevailing signification, and often occurs.
takarRahahu i. q. karihahu, q. v. (K, * TA.) See also taOajRamahu.
6: see 5.
kariyhN Disliked, disapproved of, blamed, or hated; hateful, blameable, displeasing, or odious; as also makoruwhN↓.
AlkarAahiyapu llXRaIoCi signifies AlbugoDu lahu and Eadama mulaACamatihi. (MF in art. AbI.)
kaArihN Unwilling: see an ex. voce OasaMCa.
makorahN A thing that one dislikes, disapproves, or hates, or that one dislikes to do: opposed to manoXaTN: (TA in art. nXT:) [a thing, or an event, that is an object of dislike or hatred].
makoruwhN Foul, abominable, or evil; i. q. sayRiYN; (Beyd, xvii. 40;) and XarRN: (TA:) [held in aversion]. See kariyhN.
makaArihu, a pl. of makoruwhN.
makaArihu AldRahori The afflictions, or calamities, of fortune; syn. nawaAziluhu and XadaAYiduhu. (TA.) See also makorahN.
musotakorahN: see an ex. voce EaraDN.
3. kaAraI EalaI daAbRapi He employed a beast of carriage to carry for hire. (IbrD.)
4. OakorAaniI daArahu, and daAbRatahu, He let me his house, and his beast of carriage, on hire. (Mgh.)
6: see 8.
8. AikotaraI and AisotakoraI↓ and takaAraI↓ He hired, or took on hire a house, and a beast. (Mgh.)
karFI or karFA Drowsiness. (S, Msb, K.)
kariIRN One who lets a thing on hire; (Mgh:) one who lets beasts on hire. (Msb.) See an ex. in a verse cited art. Xm, conj. 4.
And One who is hired. (Mgh, &c.) In one copy of the Mgh, AlmktriI is put by mistake for AlmukotaraI: i. q. mukorK: and mukotarFI. (TA in art. Hrm.)
kuriIRN Spherical: see Ksh in ii. 20.
kuriyRapN Sphericalness: see Bd in ii. 20.

karawoyA [Caraway-seed] is of the measure faEawolalN [and if so must be written karawoyFA]: (K:) or it may be faEawolFI: [but see what follows:] AHn says that, if with medd, it is fem. [and therefore karawoyaMCu]: but it is not Arabic [and therefore, without medd, it is probably karawoyaA]. (TA.)
karawaAnN: see DuwaEN and qabojN.
mukaArK One who lets beasts of carriage, &c., on hire; like kariIRN, q. v.; an owner, and letter on hire, of asses [&c.]. (KL.) See falRaAHN.
kaAsifu AlbaAli: see baAlN.
kawosaqN i. q. kawosajN. (M.)
2. kasRalahu, inf. n. takosiylN, said of satiety, It rendered him heavy, sluggish, lazy, indolent, or torpid. (TA.)
4. Oakosala EanohaA signifies Oawolaja walamo yunozilo; [Inivit sed non emisit;] (IAar, in TA, art. fhr;) [i. e., Oawolaja vumRa tarakahaA walamo yunozilo].
kasolaAnN Heavy, sluggish, lazy, indolent, torpid. (K.)
makosalapN: see an ex. voce kiTRapN.
1. kasawotuhu sayofFA [I invested him with a sword]. (TA in art. gXw.)
5. tksI: see tqI.
kisaMCN [A garment]. See EabaMCN, and HilosN and musayRaHN.

cuw kisaMCK, as opposed to cuwburodK, (assumed tropical:) A poor man. (S, art. Ej.) [The ksAC was evidently a simple oblong piece of cloth; for AlkisaAYiI is said to have been thus named because he wore a ksAC while in the state of UiHoraAm; as is mentioned in the TA, art. ksw; but it seems to have been sometimes sewed in the manner of the EabaMC, which see; and see also musayRaHN, and burodN.] It is [properly] not one of the garments which are cut and sewed [but is a single piece]: (Mgh, art. qTE:) [a wrapper, or wrapping garment, of a single piece].
rakiba kisaMCahu He fell upon the back of his neck. (IAar, in TA, art. rdE.)
kaAsK Having clothing: see an ex. voce rubRa.
OakosaI: see baSalN.
1. kaXafahu kaXafa Eanohu He uncovered it; unveiled it; laid it open; displayed it; exposed it to view; discovered it; detected it; revealed it; disclosed it.
kaXafa Eanohu He investigated, explored, or scrutinized, it; searched, examined, or inquired, into it.
kaXafahu He removed it; namely, a cover, or covering, or the like: and he uncovered it, laid it open, &c.; as also kaXafa Eanohu.
kaXafa XayoOF Eano XaIoCK He removed, put off, took off, or stripped off, a thing from over, or from before, a thing which it covered or concealed. (K.)
kaXafa He removed, cleared away, or dispelled, grief, or sorrow: see faraja (of which it is an explanation in the Msb and K).
See 7.
3. kaAXafahu, inf. n. mukaAXafapN, [He acted openly with him, or towards him;] syn. of the inf. n. mujaAharapN. (Har, p. 470.) He, or it, appeared to him; as also kaAXafa Ealayohi; syn. Zhr lh. (TA.)
kuwXifa bimaA Oaxofayotu He became acquainted with, knew, or got knowledge of, what I concealed: syn. UiTRalaEa Ealayohi. (Har. p. 686.)

mukaAXafapN The showing open enmity, or hostility, with any one. (KL.) [I. e. kaAXafahu alone, or] kAXfh biAlEadaAwapi signifies He showed open enmity, or hostility, with him; (S, MA, K;) and so kAXfh AlEadaAwapa. (MA.) See SafoHapN.
[Also Discovery, or revelation: pl. mukaAXafaAtN: see Hájjee Khaleefeh, s. v.]
kaAXafahu AlHaroba [He made war with him openly]. (Msb, art. nbc.)
5. takaXRafa He uncovered, or exposed, himself in sitting. (TA, voce OaEofatu.)
6. takaAXafuwA They revealed their faults, or secrets, one to another: see tadaAfanuwA.
7. AinokaXafa Eanohu [He, or it, withdrew, or became withdrawn, or removed or became removed, from him, or it, or from over it]
AinokaXafato said of a she-camel: see mufanRanN.

AinokaXafuwA [They were
routed, defeated, or put to flight; like kaXifuwA↓: the former is quasi-pass. of kaXafa, “ he routed, ” &c.]. (K, voce jAl in art. jwl.) See also tiforijapN, in art. frj.
kaXRaAfN: see Ham, p. 49, 1. 2.
makoXuwfN Uncovered, &c.; overt.
mukaAXifN [A discoverer, or revealer: thus I have rendered it voce EayonN.]
kaXokN Barley-water: (K:) or pounded wheat or barley: a Persian word, arabicized. (Mgh.) Hence, kaXokiyRapN A kind of broth. (Mgh.)
1. kaZama gayoZahu He repressed, or restrained, his wrath, or rage. (K.)

kaZama, aor.
kaZima
, inf. n. kaZomN, He restrained himself. (TA.)
maA yakoZimu EalaI jirRapK; and laA yakoZimN EalaI jirRatihi: see jirRapN.
kaZama EalaI gayoZihi i. q. kaZama gayoZahu. (TA.)
kaZaAYimu [pl. of kiZaAmapN] Subterranean conduits for water. (TA in art. qnw.)
kuEoburapN and kuEobuwrapN↓ Anything compact (K, TA) and round: (TA:) and the latter, i. q. EuqodapN [meaning a knot, or a knob]: (TA:) [pl. of the latter kaEaAbiyru: see xirowN: see also Oaxoramu].
Also The seed-vessel [i. e. siliqua, or pod,] of the radish and some other plants. (IAar, TA voce UisoHaArRN.)
kuEobuworapN: see kuEoburapN.

kaEokN A well-known bread; (K;) biscuit; (MA;) or [a kind of] dry bread: (MA, TA:) now applied to a sort of bread made in the form of a ring, hollow, [and generally containing some dbs or the like,] the best of which is brought from Syria, and given as a present. (TA.)
kuEalN: see vuEalN.
1. kaEama AlbaEiyra: see Eakama.
kiEaAmN A muzzle for a camel. (PS.)
kiEaAmapN The iron thing that embraces, or clasps, (talotaqimu,) the muzzle of the horse. (IDrd in his book on the Saddle and Bridle, p. 8.)
1. kafRa AltRawoba He sewed the edge, or border, of the garment, or piece of cloth, the second time, (S, K,) after the [slight] sewing termed AlmalRu, (S,) or AlXRalRu. (K.)
[He felled (a seam or garment).]

kafRa Eanohu, aor.
kafufa
, He refrained, or forbore, from it, as forbidden; abstained, or desisted, from it; left, relinquished, or forsook it: (Msb:) [as also AnkfR↓].
kafRa Eanohu He refrained, desisted, forbore, abstained, or held, from it. (K, &c.)

kafRahu Eanohu He made him to refrain, forbear, or abstain, from it; averted him, turned him away or back, from it; (K;) prevented, hindered, held, withheld, or restrained, him from it. (Mgh, Msb, TA.)
[kafRa bayonahumaA He interposed as a restrainer between them two: a phrase of frequent occurrence].
kafRa mina AlXRaEari (M, K, art. qSr) He shortened the hair. (M, ibid.)
3. kaAfRuwA EaduwRahumo i. q. HaAjazuwhumo, which see.
mukaAfRapN signifies i. q. muHaAjazapN, because it is a preventing, or an abstaining, from fighting. (Mgh.)
7: see 1.
kafRN [generally The hand: sometimes, app., the palm only:] accord. to Az, the palm with the fingers. (Msb.)
[Hence, A cake of the length and thickness of the hand: thus in the present day. See EujRaAlN.]
kafRN A handful; what one takes with the hand, or grasps; syn. quboDapN. (S, art. qbD.)
[Darabahu kafRFA He struck him a slap with the hand.]
[kafRN often signifies The paw of a beast.]
kafRapN: see kifRapN.

kufRapN The selvage, i. e. border, or side, of a garment or piece of cloth, (S, Msb,) that has no hudob [or end of unwoven threads]: (S, voce TurRapN:) or what surrounds the skirt of a shirt: or whatever is oblong; as the HaAXiyap of a garment or piece of cloth, and of sand: and the edge of a thing. (K.)
kifRapN The bezel, or collet, i. e. the part in which the stone is set, of a signet-ring. (TA in art. rkb.) See kurosiIRN.
See also TaroqN.
kifRapN A scale of a balance: (MA:) vulg. kafRapN↓. (K.)
kafaAfN The like of a thing. (S, K.)
Food, or sustenance, that renders one independent of others: (S, K:) or sufficient for one's want, not exceeding nor falling short. (Msb.)
kifaAfN The circuit, rim, or surrounding edge, of a thing. (S, K.)
kifaAfapN [app. a subst., not an inf. n.,] The act, or art, of sewing in the manner termed kafRN; (TA;) contr. of XilaAXapN. (TA in art. Xl.)
naAqapN kaAfRapN An old and weak she-camel. (AO, TA in art. sdm.)
[maA kaAfRapN The restrictive maA, which is annexed to OanRa UinRa, &c.: so called because it restrains the particle to which it is adjoined from exercising any government.]
kaAfRapF Wholly. (Bd and Jel in ii. 204.)
Harofu mukaAfaOapK A particle denoting compensation, or the complement of a condition; like Harofu jazaMCK.

1. kafala baAlmaAli He was, or became, responsible, answerable, accountable, amenable, surety, or guarantee, for the property (Msb) owed by another person: (IbrD:) [it may be rendered he guaranteed the property. See makofuwlN].
kafala baAlnRafosi He was, or became, responsible, answerable, amenable, or surety, for another person, (Msb,) i. e., for the latter's appearance, or presence, to answer a suit. (IbrD.)
kafalN The Eajuz [or hinder part, posteriors, buttocks, or rump]: (Msb, K:) or the ridof [or hindermost part] thereof: or the [part called] qaTan. (K.)
kafiylN One who is responsible, answerable, amenable, or a sponsor or surety. (S, K, &c.)

kafaAlapN Responsibility; answerableness; amenability; or suretiship; (S, Mgh, Msb, K;) the conjoining of one responsibility (cimRap) to another, [i. e., the conjoining one's own responsibility to that of another person,] with respect to the right of suit, [so that one person becomes liable to be sued for that which another owes]; (Mgh;) i. q. DamaAnN. (S, &c.)
mikofaAlN A woman large in the kafal [or hinder part, or posteriors]. (TA in art. vql.)

makofuwlN app. signifies Guaranteed, or pledged: for, accord. to IKtt, as is said in the Msb, you say kafalotu AlmaAla as well as kafalotu biAlmaAli; meaning I took upon myself the property; became responsible, or answerable, for it; [or I guaranteed it:] or makofuwlN is better rendered ensured by an acknowledgment of responsibility for it: see an ex. voce marohuwnN.
4. Aikofahara, said of clouds: see a verse cited EazolaMCu.

1. kafaI He, or it, sufficed, or contented: hence kafaAniI fulaAnN AlOamora Such a one sufficed me, or contented me, in respect of the affair; i. e., by taking upon himself to perform it or accomplish it if good, or to prevent it or avert it if evil: and kafaAniI XahiydFA He sufficed me as, or for, a witness; or he suffices me as, or for, such: and sometimes bi is redundantly prefixed to its agent, and sometimes to its objective complement; as in exs. cited in art. b. See Ham, p. 152. kafaI [It sufficed, or satisfied, or contented,] it stood instead of another thing, or other things; (Msb;) [as also kafaI Eano gayorihi.]
kafaI binaA for kafaAnaA &c. See W, pp. 5 and 6

kafaI, aor. yakofiI, inf. n. kifaAyapN, also signifies dafaEa and manaEa followed by mino. (Har, p. 43, q. v.) [You say, kafaAhu AlXRarRa He repelled from him evil; and hence, he defended him therefrom; and he freed him therefrom: said of God, and of a man, &c.]
8. AikotafaI biAlXRaIoCi He was, or became, sufficed by the thing, so as to need nothing more; or content with it. (Msb.)
kifaAyapN A sufficiency; enough; a thing that suffices, or contents, and enables one to obtain what one seeks. (TA, art. blg.)
qaAma bikifaAyatihi He undertook his maintenance; he maintained him; syn. maAnahu. (S, K, art. mwn.)
OakofaI [More, and most, satisfying]. (Mgh, in art. jzO.)
kaAkanajN or kaAkanojN [Pers. kaAkonajo]: see EubabN.
1. kalRa It (the sight) was, or became, dim, dull, or hebetated. (K.)
He (a camel) was, or became, fatigued, tired, or wearied. (MA.)

kalRati AlOayodiI The hands, or arms, became weak; syn. DEft [i. e. DaEaufato]. (Ham, 296.) [kalRa Eano fiEolK He was fatigued, or weak, and so disabled, or incapacitated, from doing a thing; like OaEoyaA Eanohu, and DaEaufa Eanohu: see nuxiba and Earisa.]
kalRato OasonaAnuhu, (K, art. Drs,) inf. n. kalaAlN, (S, in that art.,) His teeth were set on edge, (TK, in that art.,) by eating, or drinking, what was acid, or sour. (S, K, in that art.)
kalRa It (a sword, &c.) was blunt, and would not cut. (K, &c.)
kulRatuhunRa for kulRuhunRa: see Bd xxxi., last verse.
2. kalRala He adorned a thing with gems or jewels.
4. OakalRa OasonaAnahu [It set his teeth on edge]; said of acid, or sour, food or drink. (Ibn-'Abbád, in TA, art. Drs.) See 1.

kalRN A burden; syn. viqolN: (S, Mgh, Msb, K:) a person, or persons, whom one has to support: syn. EayRalN, (K,) and EiyaAlN: (S, Mgh, Msb, K:) applied to one and to more. (Msb.) See an ex. voce cimRapN (last sentence but two).

kulRN when preceded by a negative and followed by an exception, means Any one; as in the Kur, xxxviii. 13, Uino kulRN UilRaA kacRaba AlrRusula There was not any one but accused the apostles of lying. See also another ex. voce lamRaA.
See baEoD.

huwa AlEaAlimu kulRu AlEaAlimi [lit. He is the possessor of knowledge, the entirety of the possessor of knowledge,] means that he is one who has attained to the utmost degree of the quality thus attributed to him. (Sb, K, TA.)

s.hi: Whenever; as often as; every time that; in proportion as.

sense.s: kilRapN [musquito-curtain]: see Oabuw divaArK and baEaDa.
kulRiIRN Relating to all or the whole; universal; total: and often meaning relating to the generality; general; contr. of juzoYiIRN.
And, as a subst., A universal; that which comprises all juzoYiyRaAt, or particulars: pl. kulRiyRaAtN.
kulRiyRapN The quality of relating to all or the whole; relation to all or the whole; universality; totality: and often meaning the quality of relating to the generality; generality.
AlkulRiyRaAtu Alxamosu, in logic, The Five Predicables: namely, Aljinosu Genus, AlnRawoEu Species, AlfaSolu Difference, AlxalSRapu Property, and AlEaraDu Accident.
kaliylN Weak, or faint, lightning [app. likened to a blunt sword]. (TA in art. Eml.)
kaliylu AlZRufori: see ZuforN.
lisaAnN kaliylN A dull tongue; lacking sharpness. (S. *)
wariva rajulFA kalaAlapF, and Eano kalaAlapK, He was heir of a man who left neither parent nor offspring (IbrD.)
AlUikoliylu The 17th Mansion of the Moon; (Kzw;) the head of Scorpio. (Aboo-l-Heythem, quoted in the TA, voce raqiybN.)
AlUikoliylu Three bright stars in [or rather before] the head of Scorpio, [namely g, h, and q,] disposed in a row, transversely.
The border of flesh round the nail: (K:) in the TA, art. XZf, Uikoliylu AlZRufuri.
mukalRalN Adorned with gems or jewels. (L, art. njd; a common meaning.)

1. kalifa bihi He became attached, addicted, given, or devoted, to it; or he attached, addicted, gave, or devoted, himself to it; (S, Msb, K, TA;) he loved it: (Msb, TA:) [he was fond of it:] he loved him, [or it,] vehemently. (TA.)
kalafN, inf. n. of kalifa: [violent or intense love:] see HubRN; and see a verse cited in the first paragraph of that art.
2. kalRafa nafosahu XayoYFA He tasked himself with a thing, as also takalRafa XayYFA↓.

s.hi: He tasked him to do a thing; imposed upon him the task of doing a thing.

sense.s: So takoliyfN The imposition of a task or duty.

s.hi: A task; compulsory work; a duty imposed.

sense.s: kalRafahu AlOamora He imposed upon him the thing, or affair; syn. HamRalahu UiyRaAhu. (Msb.)
kalRafa nafosahu He put himself to trouble or inconvenience; like takalRafa↓ alone.
kalRafahu kacaA He imposed upon him the task of doing, or procuring, or bringing, such a thing.

kalRafahu OamorFA He imposed upon him a thing, or an affair, in spite of difficulty, trouble, or inconvenience: (Msb:) he ordered him to do a thing that was difficult, troublesome, or inconvenient, to him: (S, K:) he made, required, or constrained, him to do a thing; exacted of him the doing a thing; meaning, a thing that was difficult, troublesome, or inconvenient to him: (Kull, 123; and the Lexicons, passim.) See jatRamahu.

s.hi: An imposition; a requisition: con straint, &c.

sense.s: 5. takalRafa OamorFA He [undertook a thing, or an affair, as imposed upon him: or] took, or imposed, upon himself, or undertook, a thing, or an affair, [as a task, or] in spite of difficulty, trouble, or inconvenience; (Msb;) syn. tajatRamahu: (S, K:) he constrained, or tasked, or exerted, himself, or took pains, or made an effort, to do a thing; meaning, a thing that was difficult, troublesome, or inconvenient, to him: or he affected, as a self-imposed task, the doing of a thing. (The Lexicons, passim: see tgzRl: and see kalRafahu OamorFA.)
tklRf SifapF He affected, or endeavoured to acquire, a quality. So in the explanations of verbs of the measure tafaERala; as naHalRama. (Sharh El-'Izzee, by Saad-ed-Keen.)

Also, He affected, or pretended to have, a quality, not having it. So in the explanations of verbs of the measure tafaAEala, as tajaAhala: (idem:) [and sometimes in verbs of the measure tafaERala also, as takasRara &c.]. And takalRafa alone, He exercised self-constraint, or put himself to trouble or inconvenience.

takalRafa He affected what was not
natural to him.

takalRafa He used forced efforts to do a thing, and to appear to have a quality. He affected, or endeavoured to do or acquire, &c.; he constrained himself to do, &c.; he applied himself, as to a task, to do a thing. tklRf AlXRajaAEapa He made himself, or constrained himself to be, courageous; affected, or endeavoured to acquire, or characterize himself by, courage.
tklRf AlXRajaAEapa also, He acted, or behaved, with forced courage; endeavoured to be courageous.

s.hi: He used a forced, or affected, manner in his Arabic speech.

sense.s: takalRufN A straining of a point in lexicology.

taEaqRala signifies He affected or endeavoured to acquire, intelligence; explained by tklRf AlEaqola: and taEaAqala, he pretended to be intelligent, not being really so. (S, art. Eql.) takalRufN in a verb of the measure tafaERala is as above explained, signifying a desire for the existence of an attribute in one's self: in a verb of the measure tafaAEala it is different, and means the pretending to be or to do something which in reality one is not or does not; as in the instance of tajaAhala, he pretended to be ignorant, not being so in reality. (Sharh El-'Izzee, by Saad-ed-Deen.) takalRafa kacaA He did so purposely.
takalRafa AlqaIoCa He vomited intentionally. (TA, art. qIC.)
kalafN [A discolouration of the face, by] a thing that comes upon the face resembling sesame; [by freckles, accord. to present usage:] and a dingy redness that comes upon the face. (S, K.)

kulofapN A difficulty, or difficult affair, or a duty, or an obligation, that one imposes upon himself; (S, K;) or a thing imposed upon one as difficult, troublesome, or inconvenient. (Msb.) See HabRN.
[Constraint,] trouble, pain, or inconvenience. (MA.)
3. kaAlamahu i. q. naATaqahu. (TA in art. nTq.)
5. takalRama ganohu He spoke for him; syn. EabRara. (S, Msb, art. Ebr.)
6. takaAlamaA They spoke, talked, or discoursed, each with the other. (S, * M.)
kalimapN A word: (Kull, 301:) an expression: (K:) a proposition: a sentence: [a saying:] an argument. (Kull.) An assertion: an expression of opinion.

kalaAmN is a gen. n., applying to little and to much, or to few or many; (S, TA;) to what is a sing. and to what is a pl. (TA.) It may therefore be rendered A saying, &c.; and sayings, or words: see an ex. voce Oafokalu, in art. fkl.
kalaAmN Speech; something spoken; [diction; language;] parlance; talk; discourse: (Msb, &c.:) a saying: a say: something said: in grammar, a sentence. Alkalimu AlTRayRibu: see TayRitN.
kalaAmN: also, a quasi-inf. n. for tklym, sometimes governing as a verb, [like the inf. n.,] accord. to some of the grammarians; as in the following ex.:

L.foreign: yXfyk qlt SHyH cAk lw kAnA

sense.s: (Sharh Shudhoor edh-Dhahab.) See Uisomu maSodarK.

Eilomu AlkalaAmi [The theology of the Muslims;] a science in which one investigates the being and attributes of God, and the conditions of possible things with respect to creation and restitution, according to the rule of El-Islám; which last restriction is for the exclusion of the theology of the philosophers. (KT.)
rajulN kilRiymN, like sikRiytR [and HidRiyvN] i. q. minoTiyqN. (Ibn-'Abbád, Z, TA.)
kuloyapN of a bow: see Oaboharu
of a mazaAdap: see xurobapN.
mutakalRimN A Muslim theologian. See Eilomu AlkalaAmi.
1. kalaA, first pers. kalaAtu, aor. yakoluw; and kalaA, first pers. kalayotu, aor. yakolaA; inf. n., kilaAyapN; see kalaOa.
AlkulaI: the feathers so called: see manaAkibu and Oaboharu.
AlkuloyataAni A name of two stars on the ear of Taurus. (See AlkalobaAni.)
kamo: see its syn. kaOaIRK or kaOayRino voce OaIRN.

As an interrogative with the specification suppressed, What number? How many? and, as in an ex. voce siqoIN, virtually meaning How much? and so in an ex. voce masaAfapN and voce XaborN. Also How long? as in the Kur, ii. 161, &c.; a noun signifying a period of time being understood: see also an ex. voce Easafa, and voce faraXa.
kamRN and kamN are both app. right: see qado.
kimRN The calyx of a flower. (K, &c.)
kimRN The envelope [or spathe] of the TaloE [or spadix of a palm-tree]: and the covering [or calyx] of flowers or blossoms; as also kimaAmapN↓. (S, Msb, K.)
kumRapN A qalanosuwap: (TA in art. bTH:) or a round qlnswp: (S, K:) pl. kimaAmN. (K, * TA in art. bTH.)
kimaAmapN: see kimRN.
kamRiyRapN Quantum, or quantity, as answering to “ how many. ”
mukamRamN Covered over, or concealed (masotuwr). (S, art. xSb.) See buroOap.
kamokaAmN The cancamum-tree: see buTomN and DirowN.
kamaA fiyoTuws [ χαμαίπιτυς, the ground-pine]: see EaroSafN.

s.hi: A kind of belt with a receptacle for money.

sense.s: 1. kamala He, or it, was, or became, perfect; and sometimes, it was, or became, complete, entire, whole, or full; which latter signification is more properly expressed by tamRa, which see.
kaAmlN Complete with respect to bodily vigour, having attained the usual term thereof. See layovu EifirRiyna, art. Efr. Also Consummate, perfect.
Eayonu AlkamaAli: see faqaOa.
AlkaAmaAnu AlmucaAbu, mentioned in the TA, in art. nbT, i. q. Eiloku AlOanobaAT, which is applied as a lzwq to a wound.
makomanN A place of concealment, a lurking-place: (Mgh, Msb:) pl. makaAminu. (Msb.)
OaroDN kamohaMCN i. q. mugimRapN and migamRapN. (TA in art. gm.)
kamiIRN A courageous man: or one wearing arms or armour: (K:) or a courageous man covered, or protected, by arms or armour; (S;) a courageous armed man.
kinRN A place of retreat or concealment; such as a cave, and an excavated house or chamber: (Beyd, xvi. 83:) see barRN.
kinRN The shelter of a wall: see difoCN.
A thing that serves for veiling, covering, or protecting. (S, * Msb, * K.) See ZilRN, where I have thus rendered it.
kunRapN: see TanafN.
kinaAnapN: see jaEobapN.
kaAnuwnN A fire-place; a place in which fire is lighted. (S, K.)
makonuwnu AlfaAYili: see a verse of El-Aashà in art. fyl.
fAEl musotakinRN: see musotaqinN.
kanoxabapN Confusion of speech, or discourse, by reason of errors, or mistakes. (Yoo, K.) [App. an inf. n. of which the verb is kanoxaba.]
kaniysN [a kind of roast flesh-meat]: see maromuwDN.
8. Aikotanafahu Alqawomu The people were on his right and left. (Msb.)

s.hi: It bordered it on either side.

sense.s: kanafN Vicinage or neighbourhood, or region or quarter or tract, and shadow or shelter or protection. (K.)
kanafaA AlUinosaAni The man's two sides, right and left. (TA.)
kanuwfN: see qacuwrN, in two places.
kaniyfN: see zirobN.

kunaAfapN A kind of pastry, resembling vermicelli, made of fine flour and water mixed in such proportions as to compose a thin paste, which is poured into a vessel whose bottom is pierced with numerous small holes: the vessel being then moved circuitously over a large round tray of tinned copper, beneath which is a fire, the paste runs in fine streams, is quickly but slightly baked. and swept off. For eating, it is slightly baked with clarified butter (smn), and then sweetened with honey, or sometimes with treacle, or sugar.
kunaAfapN i. q. Pers. riXotaho qaTaAYifo [Thread katáïf]. (KL.) See UiToriyapN.
kanafaAniIRN A maker or seller of kunaAfap.
mukaAnifN A she-camel that lies down behind the other camels. (Az, cited in L, art. rwH.)
4. Oakonaha: see an ex. in a verse cited voce maEasRN.
kunohN: see faSRN.
kunohN may often be rendered Entity.

1. kanaI He affixed a kinaAyap, meaning, with the Koofees, a pronoun, to a verb [&c.]: (TA in art. ryb:) but accord. to the usage of the verb in two instances in the M and K, voce raAba in art. ryb, it clearly means he spoke allusively.
kanaIa bihi Eano kadam, He used it metonymically for such a word or phrase; he alluded thereby to such a thing.
kinaAyapN A metonymy: see taEoriyDN; where the difference between these two words is explained.
Also, An allusion. (TA.)
Also, and mukanRFI↓, accord. to De Sacy, in his Ar. Gr. i. 455, or mukanRK↓, for I find its plural written in a copy of the S mukanRiyaAt, A pronoun; see kanaI.
mukanRK and mukanRaI:see kinaAyapN.
kuhobapN, accord. to Ibn El-Aarábee, Yellowness inclining to redness. (TA. voce Husobap.)
8. Aikotahala, said of a plant, It became tall and full-grown: (TA:) or it became of its full height, and blossomed: (S:) see zaAxirN.
kaholN Of middle age; or between that age and the period when his hair has become intermixed with heaviness. See XabaAbN; and XayoxN and gulaAmN.
kuhuwlapN: see XabaAbN.

kaAhilN [The withers of a horse, &c.] i. q. HaArikN: or the anterior portion of the upper part of the back, next the neck, which is the upper third part, containing six vertebra: or the part between the two shoulder-blades: or the part where the neck is joined to the back how: [the base of the neck: see vabajN]. (K.)
kihaAnapN Divination: soothsaying. (K, &c.)
kaAhinN: see EarRaAfN and EaAYifN.

kuwRapN and kawRapN (S, Msb, K) and kawRN (K) A hole, or perforation. or an aperture, (S, Mgh, Msb, K,) in a wall (Msb, K) or chamber; (S, Mgh;] [a mural aperture;] or the first and second, a small one; and the third, a large one (K.) See also miXokaApN.
kArI [kaAriIRN?] i. q. gariybN, applied to a man. (AA, in TA, voce gariybN.)
kuwEN The extremity of the radius, or bone of the fore-arm, next the thumb: (S, Msb, K:) or the protuberance formed thereby.
5. takawRafa: see taXaORama.
kaAfN Same as kusRN (because it is the name of the incipient letter of this word: 1001 Nights ii. 304).
kuwfiyRapN A thing that is worn upon the head; so called because of its roundness, or its bring round. (TA.)
8. AikotaAma He walked upon the extremities of his toes, by choice. (TA, voce HaAriqapN, q. v.)

1. kaAna He or it was. A verb of the class called incomplete, (naAqiSN) because, with the agent which it comprises, or to which it relates, it cannot constitute a complete proposition; i. e., non-attributive. The other verbs of this class are, ZalRa OaDoHaI OamosaI OaSobaHa SaAra, maA daAma maAQnofakRa maA fatiYa maAbariHa maA zaAla baAta, and layosa. Each of these governs its noun, or subject, in the nom. case, and its enunciative, or predicate, in the acc. case; as, kaAna zayodN qaAYimFA Zeyd was standing.
(The n in yakuno and the like is often irregularly elided.)

kaAna, divested of all signification of time. is often used as a copula. (See De Sacy 's Gr. Ar. i. 196.) So too is kaAYinN; for hecaA zayodN and hecaA kaAYinN zayodFA signify the same. (Mughnee, voce OanRa.)
kaAna as a complete, i. e., an attributive, verb, see HaSala. in three places.
5. takawRana He, or it, received, or took, his, or its, being, or existence; came into existence; originated.
10. AisotakaAna He was, or became lowly, humble, submissive, or in a state of abasement. (Har, p. 4, q. v.) See Aisotakana in art. skn: and see art. kyn.

entry.xml:id: naEuwcu biAllRehi mn AlHawori baEoda Alkawoni

form.orth: naEuwcu biAllRehi mn AlHawori baEoda Alkawoni

sense.s: naEuwcu biAllRehi mn AlHawori baEoda Alkawoni: see HaworN and kaworN.
kayonuwnapN: see XaAxa.
makaAnapN A particular place of being or existence. See an ex. voce nafosN.
makaAnaka wazayodFA [Keep where thou art and approach not Zeyd!] Heard by Ks. (L, art. End.)
State, or condition. [Bd, xi. 122, and xxxix. 40.) See art. mkn.
makaAnN i. q. manozilapN. (Bd, xii. 77.)

s.hi: This is a ground for our saying thus.

sense.s: OaSobaHa makaAna kacaA It became as, or like, such a thing. See a verse cited voce ratomN.
1. kawaAhu He (a veterinary, and any other, TA) cauterized him; i. e. burned his skin; with an iron, and the like: (K:) or he burned him with fire. (Mgh.)
kayRaisN Intelligent; ingenious, clever. (S, Msb, K.) [Plur. kuwsaI:] also OakoyaAsN. (Msb.)
OumRu kayosaAna a metonymical name of The knee, in the dial. of El-Azd. (TA, art. rkb)
kiySN: see daniyqN.

2. kayRafotuhu fatakayRafa, used by the Muslim theologians, (K, TA,) verbs derived from kayofa, (TA,) [signifying I specified by the ascription of its quality and it became so specified,] are formed in accordance with analogy, not heard from the Arabs. (K, * TA.)
5. takayRafa: see what next precedes.
kayofiyRapN Quality as answering to “ how? ”; mode, or manner, of being.
kayofuwfiyRapN for kayofiyRapN: see tayosiyRapN.
8. AikotaAla Ealayohi minohu: see EalaI in the sense of mino.
kayolN: see mikoyaAlN.
kayRaAlN [A measurer of corn and the like]. (A, art. bxs.)
mikoyaAlN A measure with which corn is measured; (S, Msb, K;) as also kayolN↓; (Msb;) a measure of capacity.
10. AisotakaAna: see Aisotakana in art. skn: and see art. kwn.
kayonN (also written kayonapN, K, voce zaronabN): see baZorN.
kayohFA A large, or bulky, she-camel: see the last sentence in art. gcw.
